# UIVibrancyEffect

**Class**

An object that amplifies and adjusts the color of the content layered behind a visual effect view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIVibrancyEffect
```

## Overview

A vibrancy effect is intended to be used as a subview of or layered on top of a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIVisualEffectView] that has been configured with a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBlurEffect]. The use of a vibrancy effect can help the content placed inside the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIVisualEffectView/contentView] become more vivid.

The vibrancy effect is color-dependent. Any subviews that you add to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIVisualEffectView/contentView] must implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/tintColorDidChange()] method and update themselves accordingly. [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView] objects with images that have a rendering mode of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImage/RenderingMode-swift.enum/alwaysTemplate] as well as [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel] objects update automatically.

## Creating a vibrancy effect

- **init(forBlurEffect:style:)**: Creates a vibrancy effect with the specified blur and style values.
- **init(blurEffect:)**: Creates a vibrancy effect for a specific blur effect.
- **UIVibrancyEffectStyle**: Constants for the vibrancy styles.

## Deprecated

- **widgetPrimary()**: Creates a vibrancy effect suitable for use with certain supporting text and template images within a widget.
- **widgetSecondary()**: Creates a vibrancy effect suitable for indicating the secondary importance or relevance of supporting text and template images within a widget.
- **widgetEffect(forVibrancyStyle:)**: Creates a vibrancy effect for the specified style.
- **notificationCenter()**: Creates a vibrancy effect for use in Notification Center.

## Visual effects

- **UIVisualEffect**: An initializer for visual effect views and blur and vibrancy effect objects.
- **UIVisualEffectView**: An object that implements some complex visual effects.
- **UIBlurEffect**: An object that applies a blurring effect to the content layered behind a visual effect view.

## Inherits From

- UIVisualEffect

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
